meanings.definition: To move the head up and down in agreement or as a greeting.
meanings.sent1: She was nodding enthusiastically during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher nodded to show she understood the question.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept nodding off during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the breeze seemed to be nodding in agreement.
meanings.sent5: The old man sat on the porch, nodding slowly in the warm sun.

meanings.definition: Showing approval or agreement by moving the head up and down.
meanings.sent1: The nodding audience enjoyed the performance.
meanings.sent2: She gave a nodding smile to show she was happy with the result.
meanings.sent3: The nodding cat seemed to be the judge of the room.
meanings.sent4: The nodding trees outside the window seemed to cheer on the players.
meanings.sent5: The nodding dolls on the shelf made the room feel welcoming.

meanings.definition: Inclined or likely to fall asleep.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, she felt nodding and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: The warm, cozy room made her feel nodding in no time.
meanings.sent3: The nodding baby in the stroller finally drifted off to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The nodding flowers in the garden looked like they were dozing off.
meanings.sent5: The nodding student at the back of the class struggled to stay awake.
